title: NEXUS Chest Decision Instrument for Blunt Chest Trauma
description: Determines need for chest imaging in blunt trauma patients. Uses 7 criteria to identify patients at very low risk for thoracic injury who can potentially avoid chest x-ray. The score is 99% sensitive for clinically significant thoracic injury.

parameters.name: age_over_60
parameters.description: Is the patient older than 60 years?

parameters.name: rapid_deceleration
parameters.description: Rapid deceleration mechanism: fall from >20 feet (>6 meters) OR motor vehicle crash >40 mph (>64 km/h)?

parameters.name: chest_pain
parameters.description: Does the patient have chest pain?

parameters.name: intoxication
parameters.description: Is the patient intoxicated (alcohol or drugs)?

parameters.name: altered_mental_status
parameters.description: Does the patient have altered mental status (altered alertness/cognition)?

parameters.name: distracting_injury
parameters.description: Does the patient have a distracting painful injury?

parameters.name: chest_wall_tenderness
parameters.description: Does the patient have tenderness to chest wall palpation?

ranges.interpretation: No NEXUS Chest criteria are present. This patient is at very low risk for thoracic injury. Chest imaging can potentially be avoided. The negative predictive value is 98.5% for thoracic injury and 99.9% for clinically major injury.

One or more NEXUS Chest criteria are present. Cannot rule out thoracic injury. In well-appearing patients, consider chest x-ray only. In ill-appearing patients or those with multi-organ injury, consider chest CT. The score is 99% sensitive for clinically significant thoracic injury.

references: Rodriguez RM, Hendey GW, Mower W, Kea B, Fortman J, Merchant G, et al. Derivation of a decision instrument for selective chest radiography in blunt trauma. J Trauma. 2011 Sep;71(3):549-53. doi: 10.1097/TA.0b013e3181f2ac9d.

Rodriguez RM, Anglin D, Langdorf MI, Baumann BM, Hendey GW, Bradley RN, et al. NEXUS chest: validation of a decision instrument for selective chest imaging in blunt trauma. JAMA Surg. 2013 Oct;148(10):940-6. doi: 10.1001/jamasurg.2013.2757.

Rodriguez RM, Hendey GW, Marek G, Dery RA, Bjoring A. A pilot study to derive clinical variables for selective chest radiography in blunt trauma patients. Ann Emerg Med. 2006 May;47(5):415-8. doi: 10.1016/j.annemergmed.2005.10.001.
formula: NEXUS Chest Score = Sum of positive criteria (1 point each)
